Powerful pet hair pick up in a lightweight and agile design
Tangle-Free brush roll eliminates annoying hair wrap. Power Rating:7 Amps

Smart Seal Allergen System with optional Febreze filter traps dust and allergens while eliminating odors to freshen your home as you clean

body.description: At Bissell, we know pets can make a mess at any moment – that's why we created the Pet Hair Eraser Turbo. It doesn't matter if you vacuumed just hours before Fido left behind a trail of fur, you need to be ready for any mess at any moment. The Pet Hair Eraser Turbo comes with powerful pickup packed into a lightweight and agile machine for easy and convenient everyday cleanup. Enjoy the quick release extension wand which is always on and always ready to tackle those tricky, hard-to-reach pet messes around the home. Plus, with features like the Tangle-Free brush roll and the One-Touch, easy empty dirt tank, you don't have to worry about cleaning your vacuum after you’ve cleaned your home. You can also breathe easy with the Smart Seal Allergen System with Febrile that traps dirt and allergens and eliminates odors so you can enjoy a fresher, cleaner home. Buying this product saves pets. Bissell proudly supports Bissell Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a Bissell product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear. Febreze logo is a registered trademark of the Procter & Gamble company, Cincinnati, Ohio used under license by Bissell Home Care.

SmartSeal Allergen System Traps fine dust and allergens inside the vacuum so you can breathe easy. Specialized Pet Tools Exclusive tools provide a customizable clean for pet messes all over your home.

Hands-Free Empty Cyclonic Pet Hair Spooling System means you no longer have to touch the yuck. Quick Release Extension Wand Always on, always ready to tackle messes in those hard-to-reach spots. Febreze Pet Odor Eliminator Filter Only BISSELL has a vacuum with an optional Febreze filter to eliminate pet odors

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Should have bought it sooner!
reviews.reviewText: We have 2 dogs, three cats, and 5 humans in our home, and all I can say about this vacuum is that I wish I had purchased it sooner!I vacuumed the same spot three times in a row, and each time it pulled up more hair from the carpet. It's easy to use, and the tools included are great. It's a little heavier than expected, but not unwieldy. Cannister empties easily and the unit is easy to assemble out of the box.This is a great vacuum, and I can recommend it without reservation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First, I don't typically write reviews. I've been an Animal Dyson girl for years but lately I just haven't felt like my Dyson was doing what I needed it to do. I have 3 dogs, a cat and lots of people. I tried this based on reviews and suggestions and I absolutely LOVE IT! The suction is great, it slides under the edges of my furniture easily and the attachments work well.The things I wish were different...the cord could be about 5ft longer. I wish it were a lighter. Beware of the green seal when using attachments, if you don't hold the nozzle just so, the seal will dislodge and you have to keep putting it back in place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The dirt this vacuum picked up left me obsessed with my new vacuum
reviews.reviewText: I love this vacuum!I’m going to start with MY cons for those just looking for negatives, but please read on because I have more positive things than negative things to say.Cons:The hose gets twisted very easy when going back and forth between the vacuum and hose. Simple to untwist.The joint from the head to the motor/body is just a little more weak than I’d like. If I’m using the hose and reaching too far it will fall over, while the head stays on the floor. I can see how this would be beneficial for anyone that has decreased strength when trying to vacuum normally, but for me it’s annoying. I just keep my vacuum body right next to me with my hand on the top if I’m really reaching.The standard filter it comes with is not sealed in plastic. I wish I would’ve used the standard filter first instead of the sealed fabreze filter it additionally came with. The standard filter is basically collecting dust in my cleaning pantry.For smaller solid debris it clogged easily. Sunflower seed shells specifically. It was easy to take apart and fix though.Sometimes hair gets caught around the green center in the canister. If you give the canister a twisty-shake it will fall off into two pieces, and subsequently into the trash. It’s just messy to get loose. There is no place on the vacuum to attach the roller, so you’ll have to find somewhere to store it.The Pros/ background;Our first vacuum was a shark navigator.... 5 years ago. It worked great in our tiny apartment for $150 but then pets, kids, moving, and a crack in the bottom hose happened and it just wasn’t doing the job anymore. We have 3 cats, so I wanted something that I KNEW would get ALL the cat hair. I order the Bissell from amazing warehouse for $160 versus the $230 (ish) it costs brand new. It was in the original box, there was no dust in the tubing, and all of the pieces were still individually wrapped in bissell bags.My order took a little over a week to arrive, and I didn’t vacuum from the moment I ordered it. Normally I would’ve vacuumed 5 times in that time frame. When it arrived it took about 5 minutes to assemble and read all the instructions/warnings.I first used my old vacuum to vacuum my 9’x11’ rug - then I used the bissell. I love validating a big purchase, and this definitely SHOWED me it was worth getting a new vacuum, especially this one.We do not wear shoes in our house - and I carpet clean between every 2 weeks to once a month (I like how it fluffs my carpet). I expected the vacuum to outperform my 5 year old shark... but I didn’t expect what you see in the pictures. It picked up all of the super fine cat hairs, and so, SO MUCH DIRT. 🤢 I cannot believe all of that was in my rug, which I’ve only had 17 months.The pictures speak for themselves... it has amazing suction power. The attachments are nice also, I like the LED wand, and the pet hair rubber tipped one even more. The attachment that rolls when you connect it is nice for the stairs, but aside from the rubber coated roller inside, it is similar to others I’ve used before.It maneuvers wonderfully, with a twist of the wrist to makes very smooth turns. Because of the way the head is attached to the motor you are able to turn the head basically 90 degrees while keeping the motor/body of the vacuum straight. That makes getting around my dining table chairs much faster when I’m not moving all of the chairs.I liked that the handle, where your thumb would naturally rest, is where you adjust for carpet thickness. Moving from plush carpet to my rug is fast because I just flip the vent with my thumb for lower carpet setting.The hose is great on the handle, and has equal suction ability as the vacuum (if not more).Mine came with a Febreze filter insert in addition to the unscented original. It does smell amazing when running my vacuum, and is surprisingly only noticeable when running the vacuum. This is not mandatory to use if you are sensitive to smells. It comes in with a non scented filter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is HEAVY, FANTASTIC, I loathe to vaccume. My OCD likes the roller brush lines. Thanks Bissell
reviews.reviewText: I have had laminate floors and hard wood floors for years - I have pets and hate having carpet. So, we finally sold our house in crappy California and purchased a home in Tennessee. Bad part, it has a house FULL of carpet. We have a double coated Border Collie/German Shepard, American Staffy, and a cat. I have really long hair and it falls out constantly. This vacuum is AMAZING - I got it on sale on National Pet Day or whatever it was called, ( it was last month and I got it for like $120 LESS than regular price) So, it was a no brainer. The canister is SO much better to empty than the Dyson you and everything falls out like it should. Dyson you had to stick your hand up in the canister and pull all the hair and crap out of it. It was disgusting. It's pretty heavy for me, im 5'6 and 127 so I need to raise the beater brush up higher because if it's too low, it's almost impossible to pull or push it. Im being dramatic - it's not impossible, but it's extremely difficult. It's extremely powerful. I really like it. Now, I need to buy a wet/dry/steam vac do to the carpets when someone barfs or brings in a dead bird or maimed squirrel as a gift for mom and dad. any suggestions on something that keeps the water SUPER Hot and will DRY very quickly. Bueller, Bueller, anyone, anyone, Hawley Smoot Tariff Act?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Vacuum keeps getting plugged at the base and have to keep taking off the bottom of the vauum and get out handsful of pet hair. The diameter of the vacuum hose is not wide enough properly suck up the pet hair. Definitely not meant for pet hair. Suction sucks!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must have for people with my problem
reviews.reviewText: I am not the guy who says "this vacuum cleaner changed my life" but... We have two huge Husky-Shepard mix dogs and when I say they shed, I mean they shed like it kinda snows in north Canada in the winter. It's insane and my Dyson was just useless. It's been a long time since I owned a corded vac but man, it's a different world and this thing is awesome. To the critics; yes, it blows dust and hair away if you move too quickly because, well... physics. Slow down. Yes, you can stall the roller brush motor by getting it stuck on something. Takes two seconds to reboot it. The upholstery brush for pet hair won't get everything if you are in zoom mode but if you go slow then it will. It changed my life. Oh. Well... I guess I am that guy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This vacuum actually went beyond my expectations. It has a powerful suction and removes all of the dog hair that had accumulated in our carpet from our pet dog.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great vacuum for picking up pet hair
reviews.reviewText: Works well on carpet to pull up pet hair. Easy to use and not too heavy to carry up and down stairs. Only issue is the holding container is a bit small and needs to be empty a bit more often. But it fills up quickly because it does a great job getting everything my other vacuum left behind.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best bang for your buck!
reviews.reviewText: I have been a diehard supporter of bissell products for years. This vacuum is no exception…from the ease of use…the fabulous suction…the machine gets the job done.My needs however have changed…I no longer have a carpeted household…instead I have a hardwood floor household. This bissell is perfect for me…it has a beater bar that has the capacity to vacuum but not to be in use …perfect for hardwood. When I want to use the beater bar for the small amount of carpet I have, I just press a button and on it comes. Love this bissell.

Well my to cats who are long hair Calico's and with the carpet and area rug I have, there was always a light hair "film" left behind from my old vacuum, very frustrating.This was a super fast delivery so I was happy to get started.I found it very easy to assemble, it is however a bit weighted, but still a one hand task. I love the "long pile/short pile" options this way it can really dig into the different carpet, and that it does! The suction is good and I like how the beater bar gets right in there and have no hassle of hair build up. I find the LED lighting useless but it's there and maybe helpful to some. I also liked that I could use it on my kitchen floor. The accessories work really well, the mini power head did a great job on my cat trees and the window beds they sleep in. I even did the drapes with the soft brush and went hog wild and did my mattress, and clean out the radiators, just so see how versitile it could be, in all situations it did a nice job.The one thing though, is I wish the hose was a few inches longer to be able to reach the top of the large cat tree. The other thing I was slightly disappointed in is that it doesn't get under a bed and such very well because of its design, oh well have to pull out the bed somethings I guess. It stores in a tight space nicely and the canister is very easy to clean and empty. I have the manual cord wind up version, for the few seconds it takes to wind up the cord I don't see how the automatic one is worth it. Really it just has a little weight but it is a solid piece of kit.

After breaking 3+ vaccums I have finally found a match that withstands the constant shedding from my cat. It picks up the fur without any problems from my carpet. I also use it in my wood floors without a scratch.
I have cleaned carpet, car seats and my living room chairs. Great and easy to move .
